class.summary: Provides the base class from which the use-case specific calculations classes can be derived.

remarks.para: Create inhertited classes from this base class to define, run and retrieve a result of your calculations.

item.description:
Your class inheriting from EvaluationScope<T> is a logical unit to compute desired result. Place lambda expressions,
input parameters or constants of types derived from or in your derived implementation.

description.para: Inheriting from EvaluationScope<T>, where T is a result class type returned by ToResult() method.

class.summary: Provides the base class from which the domain specific numer-like classes types can be derived.

Name.remarks: Either custom name provided when declaring a value or automatically captured by compiler when using buil-in helper methods.

Expression.summary: Metadata of expression that yielded this value.
Expression.remarks: Entire calculation tree can be discovered by visiting this property starting from final result instance.

Origin.remarks: Provides an understanding of the origin and classification of a value in respect to it's source and usage.
